turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Polish State Railroads in summer 1939.
turn.1: What was the state of the Polish State Railroads in summer 1939?
turn.2: Even though the Polish railway network in 1939 had deficiencies, the majority of important cities had convenient rail connections with each other.
turn.3: what are some examples of the deficiencies?
turn.4: The major exception was the connection of Wilno to the seaport of Gdynia, some 500 km away.
turn.6: Trains running on this route had to cover a distance of about 900 km, because they had to go via Warsaw.
turn.7: were any routes or routes shortened?
turn.8: Construction of a line that would shorten this distance was planned, but the start of World War II prevented any work.
turn.10: This line would have taken the route: Lapy (on the Warsaw-Białystok line) – Ostrołęka – Przasnysz – Mława (located on the Warsaw – Gdańsk/Gdynia line).
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Another rail connection whose construction was stopped by the war was the line Dębica – Pilzno – Jasło.
